title: Thin film - 480 nm light and glass-air-glass

content.question: A beam of light of wavelength <math alttext="480 nanometers" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>480</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>nm</mtext></math> in air is incident on a setup consisting of two blocks of glass that are separated by a narrow air gap, as shown in the figure. There are antireflection coatings on both the left surface of Block <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and the right surface of Block <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, so that <math alttext="100 percent" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>100</mn><mi>%</mi></math> of any incident light is always transmitted at these surfaces. Both blocks have a refractive index of <math alttext="1.50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1.50</mn></math>. What is the thinnest nonzero air gap that results in the maximum amount of light being transmitted through the two blocks?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
